title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to accelerate the increases in contribution limits to retirement plans and to increase the required beginning date for distributions from qualified plans.
content: Retirement Savings and Security Act of 2002 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to accelerate, to 2003, increases to: (1) the $5,000 deductible IRA limit. And (2) the $15,000 elective deferral and the State, local, and tax-exempt organizations' plan limits, the $10,000 SIMPLE plan limit, and catch-up contribution limits. Increases incrementally, from the current of age 70 12 to age 75 starting in 2007, the required beginning date for distributions from qualified plans.
